clinical_study.brief_title: Early Mobilisation in the Surgical Robot Assisted Spinal Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Early Mobilisation in the Surgical Robot Assisted Spinal Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, patients who underwent lumbar spine surgery in our hospital were included. A prospective study was conducted to investigate the effects of early mobilisation on postoperative complications, functual outcomes and patient satisfaction after robotic assisted lumbar spinal surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Low back pain and leg pain is an important sign and a frequent patient complaint. The VAS pain scoring standard (scores from 0 to 10) was as following: 0 means painless; 1-3 means mild pain that the patient could endure; 4-6 means patient was in pain that could be endured and be able to sleep; and 7-10 means patient had intense pain and was unable to tolerate the pain.

Low back pain and leg pain is an important sign and a frequent patient complaint. The VAS pain scoring standard (scores from 0 to 10) was as following: 0 means painless; 1-3 means mild pain that the patient could endure; 4-6 means patient was in pain that could be endured and be able to sleep; and 7-10 means patient had intense pain and was unable to tolerate the pain.

secondary_outcome.description: The Japanese Orthopedic Association score was used to evaluate the neurological function of patients with lumbar degeneration and treatment effectiveness. The highest possible total score from categories for a normal person is 29 points. Therefore, treatment improvement rate = [(post-treatment score - pre-treatment score) / (29 - pre-treatment score)] × 100%, and ≥75% means excellent; 50%-74% means good; 25%-49% means fair; 0-24% means poor.

The Japanese Orthopedic Association score was used to evaluate the neurological function of patients with lumbar degeneration and treatment effectiveness. The highest possible total score from categories for a normal person is 29 points. Therefore, treatment improvement rate = [(post-treatment score - pre-treatment score) / (29 - pre-treatment score)] × 100%, and ≥75% means excellent; 50%-74% means good; 25%-49% means fair; 0-24% means poor.

The Oswestry Disability Index is one of the principal condition-speciﬁc outcome measures used in the management of spinal disorders. Rounding the percentage to a whole number is suggested for convenience. So the final score may be summarized as: [total score / (5 × number of questions answered)] × 100%. It is suggested rounding the percentage to a whole number for convenience. We defined that 0-20% means mild; 21%-40% means moderate; 41%-60% means severe; 61%-80% means very severe；80%-100% means patients very exaggerated symptoms.

arm_group.arm_group_label: First ambulation at 24 hours after operation
First ambulation at 4 hours after operation

intervention.intervention_name: first ambulation at 4 hour after operation
intervention.description: Two groups were conducted for first ambulation at 4 or 24 hours aftër operation
intervention.arm_group_label: First ambulation at 4 hours after operation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of degenerative diseases or spinal fracture
- single level instrumentation sugery
- sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- multilevel instrumentaion surgery
- diagnosis of severe osteoperosis (BMD < 60mg/cm3) by QCT
- coagulant function abnormality
- severe internal disease
- not suitable for inclusion
